page.title: 02Language in Mansfield
page.content: The language in Mansfield is unusual. A lot of the words spoken are peculiar to the dialect. They say such things as "geroff" which means get off, "gizitere" which means give it to me, "geore" means stop it. Here is a list of words spoken in and around Mansfield. "Wata" - means water. "Onerbort" - means what are you saying. "Sezzit" - means said it. "Gowin" - means going. "Gerinside" - means get inside. "Balliniseadoff" - means shouting very loud. "Thatweryerfault" - means that was your fault. "Shutyergob" - means close your mouth. "Shatup" - means shut up.
